rename.from: "Public Cloud Archive" backend does not support copy FROM container
rename.to: "OVH Public Cloud Archive" backend does not support copy FROM container

body:
What do you think rclone should be doing?

Is there some API needed to fetch a file from cold storage?

i am not a developer, but it seems OVH/pca API  provides [specific headers](https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/storage/pca/api/) **policy_retrieval_delay** and **policy_retrieval_state** to handle this. If a GET request returns a delay in **policy_retrieval_delay** , maybe rclone cloud just wait this retrieval delay and not die.

Or if no delay is returned with headers, maybe adding an Rclone only parameter to manually enter this delay.

Could you post the result of

    rclone -vv --dump headers --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1 copy ovh:bucket/archived-file /tmp

where the source object is archived?

Yes, this time, time to unfreeze is 4 hours (Retry-After: 14604) whereas it was just 10 minutes the last time.
```
rclone -vv --dump headers --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1 copy secret_thierrybo-desk_tests:rdiffdir /tmp

Can you have a go with this

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-093-g71e0e8b0-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

If you use the `-vv` flag you should see messages like this

    Sleeping for %v to obey Retry-After

when rclone is sleeping to as instructed by the Retry-After header.

I do not see "Sleeping ....." in output:

```
 rclone -vv --dump headers --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1 copy secret_thierrybo-desk_tests:rdiffdir /tmp

> --low-level-retries 1

You'll need to set this bigger than 1 for it to work.

So I removed "`--low-level-retries 1 --retries 1`" to get the default behavior with this command line:
`
rclone -vv --dump headers copy secret_thierrybo-desk_tests:rdiffdir.1 /tmp`

[rclone_output_20190318_1321.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/2978036/rclone_output_20190318_1321.txt)

Thanks for testing that.  I'm not quite sure what is going on yet, so here is a version which
- doesn't sent 100-continue for GET requests (which is bad but may not be the problem)
- logs more info eg `Open rxHeaders = swift.Headers{"Accept-Ranges":"bytes", "Content-Length":"7", "Content-Type":"application/octet-stream", ...}`

Can you do the test above again with this please - thanks

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-105-g30ee43ae-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Ah, this is the problem

> 2019/03/18 19:11:18 INFO  : Open rxHeaders = swift.Headers(nil)

Which must mean the library isn't parsing the headers if it returns an error...

I've patched that, so can you try this please

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-106-gecaff1c0-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

OK here is a slightly more organised version of the above.  It should also print debug.

Can you have a go please?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-105-ga8698782-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

> Here is with the last build. This one is only ten minutes, I will edit this when finished:

Ah, so that looked like it worked!

What do you think - is that good enough?

Here is the code without the debug printing

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-104-gea8360c3-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Yes it looks good, thanks. I did not yet tried to copy a whole directory, but I'm sure it will unfreeze files sequentially? ie. trying to get the first file, wait for it some hours, then unfreeze the second file, wait some hours and so on.
I bet it would be very more complicated to unfreeze all files within the path on first pass to initiate the unfreeze process, then copy them after the delay  (as each file may have different delays)

> Yes it looks good, thanks. I did not yet tried to copy a whole directory, but I'm sure it will unfreeze files sequentially? ie. trying to get the first file, wait for it some hours, then unfreeze the second file, wait some hours and so on.

I didn't think of that...  You can set `--transfers` large to do that many files at once but that isn't a very good solution.

> I bet it would be very more complicated to unfreeze all files within the path on first pass to initiate the unfreeze process, then copy them after the delay (as each file may have different delays)

I guess what you'd want to is return the delay up to the copying process then sleep at the end then do a high level retry at the end after sleeping for the amount of time...

So I'd implement a DelayUntil error which would be returned.  The sync process then would keep track of the latest time received in DelayUntil errors, and when it came time for a retry sleep for that long then do a retry.

So when you did `rclone copy` it would
- copy any files it could finding the latest time it has to sleep until
- sleep for that long
- retry which would copy any remaining files.

If the time to sleep in the `Retry-After` was less than 1 minute (say) then rclone should probably just do the sleep then and there.

...

Try this

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-105-gb9b8a22a-fix-3041-swift-retry-after-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It should do one try then print

    "Received retry after error - sleeping until %v (%d)"

then sleep and do another high level retry.

rename.to: "OVH Public Cloud Archive" backend does not support copy from cold container
